advise.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something
advise.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She needed someone to advise her.
The makers advise extreme caution when handling this material.
I would advise you to speak to a doctor.
I/we would advise somebody to do something
‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place, ’ Otley advised him.
If you need more information, I’m sure your lawyer can advise.
Evans advised him to leave London.
You are strongly advised to take out medical insurance when visiting China.
I’d advise you against saying anything to the press.
Experts advise that you should avoid being in strong sunlight for long periods.
advise.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to be employed to give advice on a subject about which you have special knowledge or skill
advise.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He advises us on tax matters.
She’s been asked to advise on training the new sales team.
He advises us on tax matters.
Matthew advises people how to invest their money.
advise.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Keep us advised of (=continue to tell us about) any new developments.
We’ll advise you of any changes in the delivery dates.
They advised him that the tour would proceed.

advise.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: advise
to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you have more experience or knowledge than they do
My lawyer advised me to plead guilty.
give advice
to advise someone about questions relating to a particular subject
They give advice to people about loans.
Can I give you some advice?
to tell someone what you think they should do, especially in order to avoid problems
My dad told me to talk to a teacher if I was being bullied.
I told her not to worry.
recommend
to advise someone to do something, especially after careful study of that subject
Doctors recommend eating five portions of fruit and vegetables each day.
Current guidelines recommend that young babies should sleep on their back.
suggest
to tell someone your ideas about what they should do
I suggested they should visit the cathedral while they’re here.
urge
to strongly advise someone to do something
Police have urged anyone with information about the murder to contact them.
